resources.string: Answer the questions below and check your dental knowledge!
1. The hardest material in human body is:
3. A little bleeding of the gums after brushing or flossing is normal.
4. Aspirin placed next to a tooth is a good way to relieve a toothache.
5. Baby teeth don’t need to be brushed because they fall out.
6. If you`re not having any pain in your mouth, there’s no need to see a dentist.
7. How often should you change your toothbrush?
8. Which amount of toothpaste is appropriate? Select the picture below:
9. How many teeth do children have in primary dentition? Please fill in a number:
When was the last time you saw your dentist? Take care of yourself!
Wow! Your dentist should be proud to have you!

Brush your teeth two times a day with fluoridated toothpaste at least for two minutes. Brush the inside, outside and biting surfaces of the teeth using swirling motion with light pressure. Use a special one-tooth brush for places which are hard to reach.

Take care of your interdental spaces - most of the caries cases happen out there! Spaces between your teeth should be cleaned with a dental floss and interdental brushes, which are meassured and prescribed by dental professional.

Have a balanced diet! Limit between-meal snacks, avoid sugary food and drinks with low nutritional value. More water, whole grains, fresh fruits and vegetables, less sugar-filled sodas, sweetened fruit drinks, biscuits and sweets.
See your dentist at least once a year unless your doctor told you otherwise.
Take care of yourself and don`t forget to smile!
Please enter a guess at Question 9!
